title: Foundational Computer Science Competency Enhancement Course Using Blended Learning: Scientific Inquiry and Experiment-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer proficiency (file management, internet searches, etc.) and foundational understanding of scientific methodologies (hypothesis formulation, experimental design, etc.)
context.additional_context: Utilizes simulation/VR content reflecting real work scenarios to enhance job applicability for current practitioners. Blended learning structure comprising two weekly face-to-face sessions (experiment design and result analysis) and three online activities (data collection and measurement). Systematically applies scientific methodologies including observation, analysis, and conclusion-drawing throughout the learning process

learning_goals: Understand algorithm design principles and apply scientific inquiry methods to implement and analyze simple problems in a simulation environment.
Visualize data structure concepts in a VR environment and systematically explain their application, considering variables and measurement methods.

Learners can develop prototype solutions for two real-world business scenarios (e.g., logistics optimization, data analysis) using computer science theories (algorithms, data structures, etc.) in 3–4-member team projects and submit a report achieving over 70% in evidence-based evaluation criteria (functionality 40%, creativity 30%, collaboration efficiency 30%).

resources: 15 Sets of VR Headsets (Rotational Use for Groups of 5)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
